app.title: Digital Kindness Compass
app.subtitle: Netiquette Matters Project
app.placeholder: How will you spread kindness today?

tasks: Reply politely and constructively to a negative comment you see on social media today.
Leave an encouraging comment on a stranger's project or post.
Reduce your screen time by 30 mins today and talk to a friend face-to-face.
Chat with a friend about why sharing photos without permission is wrong.
Use only positive and supportive emojis in WhatsApp groups today.
Send a digital thank you message to a former teacher or mentor.
Congratulate the losing team ('Good game!') in the online game you play today.
Share an educational account that shares useful info on your social media story.
If you see a friend being cyberbullied, don't stay silent and support them.
Check if everything you post today is 'True, Kind, and Necessary'.

questions.title: What do you do when faced with anger in a discussion?
choices: Wait a bit and write a calm reply.

questions.title: You notice a friend shared incorrect info. What do you do?
You want to leave a positive comment on an anonymous post. What do you write?
choices: I disagree and this is silly.
Well done, I found this useful.

questions.title: How do you behave when someone makes a mistake in a chat group?
What should you check before posting?
choices: Whether it will make the sharer famous.

questions.title: You want to support someone online; what is the best approach?
choices: Share my experience and show empathy.

questions.title: What should be done to protect someone’s privacy?
choices: Avoid sharing photos and info without permission.

questions.title: If you see info you don’t know is true, what do you do?
choices: Check the source and verify if needed.

questions.title: What is your first step if you witness cyberbullying?
choices: Take screenshots and share them widely.
Support the target and report to authorities if needed.

questions.title: If your arguments aren’t solid in a debate, what should you do?
choices: Admit mistake and be open to learn.

questions.title: How do you create a kind profile on a new social network?
choices: Use respectful language and accurate descriptions.

questions.title: Which setting should you check to respect privacy?
choices: Privacy settings showing who can view my account.

questions.title: When should you leave a heated discussion?
choices: When I want it to deepen further.

questions.title: What to consider when thanking someone online?
choices: Just sending an emoji is enough.

questions.title: Why is source-checking important before sharing online?

december.title: DECEMBER: Digital Language and Tone
december.goal: To understand the importance of respectful language online.

weeks.title: Examples of tone and style in digital communication
activities: Workshop: Writing the same message in three versions – rude, neutral, and polite.
Group work: “Ways to end an argument politely.”

weeks.title: Positive language and verification
activities: Week task: Students use positive language on social media for one week and bring screenshots to class.
Introduction to fact-checking and information verification methods.
Workshop: “Real or fake?” – Students analyze sample news headlines and discuss.
